intro: Trigonotis minuta, commonly known as the dwarf trigonotis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny conditions. It has a low-growing habit with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Trigonotis minuta is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
